note: Salar has three regional varieties, the Gaizi (Alitiuli), the Mengda (Munda), and the Ili varieties (Yakup 2002: 15–28; Dwyer 2007: 77).
Contemporary Salar has no written form. However, clear evidence shows that Salar was written in Arabic-based Turki script until the nineteenth century (Tenišev 1976a: 4–8).
title: Nearly 5,000 Salars live in Xinjiang Uyghur Autonomous Region, mostly in the Xunhua Salar Autonomous County, the Gandan rural district of the Hualong Hui Autonomous County of the Qinghai Province, and the Jishishan Bao’an Dongxiang Salar Autonomous County of the Gansu Province
The endonym of the Salars living in Qinghai and Gansu is salïr or salar. The Salars in Xinjiang prefer salalïḳ. The designation of their own language is salïr-ča or sala(r)ɣa-ča
